snippet: Fewer jobs are being eliminated, leading to a decline in the filings for unemployment benefits.
abstract: Labor Department reports that applications for weekly unemployment benefits dropped by 26,000 to a seasonally adjusted 323,000, lowest level in three months, as layoffs remain at prerecession levels.
lead_paragraph: Fewer jobs are being eliminated, leading to a decline in the filings for unemployment benefits.

headline.main: New Jobless Claims Fall to a Three-Month Low
headline.print_headline: New Jobless Claims Fall to a Three-Month Low
